description: This Dropbox client works fine, but it doesn't have some of the advanced features of Dropbox on other platforms. There's no "online only" option, just selecting which folders to sync. And the list of recently changed files always seems to be missing the most recent changes, though they have actually gone through fine. Overall it's just an out-of-date version of Dropbox that they don't seem to have updated in years, but it does the job.
summary: It works but the Linux version lacks features

description: Thank you, very cool!
add sync bar progress or something like that.
summary: Cool for sync and download big files

description: I'd installed on Linux Centos 8, and it's running smoothly like on Windows platform, thanks dropbox team
summary: run perfectly, after twice installing on centos 8

used for syncing game saves. Thank you.
Downloads, installs and appears in system tray. But it wont allow me to sign in to my drop account.

It does the job with dropbox.

Create a linked folder from your synced folder to your emulation folder.

If the sign in windows does not open, execute this on a terminal:

systemctl restart --user xdg-desktop-portal
summary: Good way to keep your emulator saves

description:
I was initially having troubles signing in. Big thanks to the user who posted this tip. Enter the following line in Konsole first, then try signing-in:

systemctl restart --user xdg-desktop-portal
summary: UPDATED Review: Works Great on SteamOS

description: Need to be able to make things online only
cannot login on steamOS
can't get it to work on steam deck
stuck on starting up on steamdeck

Make sure you log in and open Dropbox first in your browser. Then, install Dropbox. When you first time launch it, Dropbox shoud open a new tab in your browser to verify it is you. Just click yes and you good to go. 

Hope this help :D
summary: Able to run Dropbox on Steam Deck

description:
There's a specific way to install this. Works on the Steam Deck.
1) Login into dropbox.com on your default browser
2) Install from here
3) Open Dropbox and it'll open a page on your default browser
4) Click "yes" on the page
5) Success!

If you don't do it in this order, it won't work. Happy Dropboxing!
No online only? :( my ssd is full now
I have no qualms against it. It's able to sync fine. And work properly!! Amazing experience.

You'll get an error on immutable distros like Silverblue, Kinoite, Bazzite, etc. To get around this, you have to explicitly select /var/home/[username] instead of /home. I don't know why this works, but it does. I got Dropbox to sync on Bazzite.

If you dual boot with windows and want to use the same dropbox folder for windows and linux, well you can't. You would have to create a new redundant dropbox folder on the ext4 drive.
Would not recommend for dual-booters.
summary: No longer support having the dropbox folder on a ntfs drive/partition

description: Only 3 devices are available in the free version. For now I'm using Nextcloud as it's open source and supports as many devices as needed (for free). Dropbox has contributed a lot to the open source community and is great but it itself is unfortunately propietary.
summary: It's really good but unfortunately is not open source

description: Ever since they hired the warmonger Condoleezza Rice

The software does actually synchronize my files, due to the fact that there are settings leftover from a previous install. 
At the moment, I have no way of opening the settings window, and no way to make the program autostart.
I can't adjust sync. speed, and I can't pause.
Installed from software in Fedora 35. (Flatpak).
Tried to contact support Dropbox, got passed between some different people, who it seems did not read the full transcrip of the chat. Answer not working, and case marked as closed from support side, without confirmation either way from me.
summary: No autostart and no gui at all. Fedora 35

description:
Installed on Fedora 35 - it's my second day on Fedora. Unfortunately, I can't seem to find settings that will allow me to select the directories that I want to synchronize. This is an option available on all other platforms, including UBUNTU. 

DropBox on Fedora is not for me, at least not now.

Dropbox on Linux has always been a pain. But it seems the flatpak solves that - so long as I remember to install it that way next time!

If you don't see the icon, it's probably a Fedora dumbism, not a Dropbox one. I have the "Tray Icons Reloaded" Gnome extension - fixes several icon-not-showing problems for me.
Once it works once it doesn't. But great that there is a Linux version
Really? Just a link to Dropbox.com?
It does sync and generally behaves as expected. Dropbox itself is not my favourite Cloud Provider but this app works well enough.
Dropbox is running, but it advises, that the file system is no longer supported. File system is default system for Linux, and worked perfectly on previous Linux (Mint 21.1) system.
Great wrapper to facilitate to mount Dropbox locally, simple and work like it should. Tested on fedora 38 on Gnome 44.

I installed the default one (.deb) from the website on my ubuntu machine 23.04. Today it started showing error messages with the key. I uninstalled that and installed this flatpak version. No headache! Thanks for your support. Keep up the good work!
summary: It works as expected with no issue

description: There is no way to control the settings on this app for example choose sync folders as it does not lunch a desktop client just your files
summary: does not lunch a desktop client just your files

description: Tried installing and won't show up. I can't uninstall either... had other issues as well
Doesn't work on Fedora Silverblue as Flatpak
Test Test Test Test Test

Die Synchronisierung läuft zuverlässig, schnell und ohne Probleme.
Leider ist es nicht grafisch möglich Einstellungen vorzunehmen, wie mal den Ableich anzuhalten, oder mit einem Klick einen Ordner nicht zu synchronisieren.

Die Flatpak-Version funktioniert wunderbar und erfüllt ihren Zweck wirklich zuverlässig. Einzig das Tray-Icon ist komplett nutzlos, da man mit diesen nicht interagieren kann, wie mit der nativen Version. Gerne würde ich die Synchronisation bei Bedarf einfach pausieren können, um z.B. Akku zu sparen.

Le daemon ne synchronise pas sur Fedora, ou alors quand il veut, mais quand ? Il n'y a pas d'icone sur les dossiers de la Dropbox qui indique l'état, et l'icone appli ouvre les fichiers, pas d'interface d'accès aux menus : synchroniser, voir en ligne, partager...
summary: Le daemon ne sync pas sur Fedora

description: Начал пользоваться этой програмкой, но встретил ОЧЕНЬ неприятный баг: при запуске окрывает почему-то файлы системы с двумя папками. Одна папка сам код программы, а вторая - кэш. Ненадёжное для хранения файлов! Буду надеятся, что все мои работы там не "скрашевались" как сам dropbox.
